assessmentItem.title: Many university-based social science researchers use students in their classes as research subjects when they conduct experiments. How does this affect the generalizability of the results of the research?

prompt.span: Many university-based social science researchers use students in their classes as research subjects when they conduct experiments. How does this affect the generalizability of the results of the research?

simpleChoice.span: College students are representative of the population as a whole, so using this sample increases the generalizability of the results.
It depends on the size of the college student sample.
College students aren’t representative of the population as a whole, so using this sample decreases the generalizability of the results.
Using college students as a sample affects the replicability of the results.
Using college students as a sample has no effect on the generalizability of the results.
